item.title: [HBASE-16611] Flakey org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestReplicasClient.testCancelOfMultiGet
item.description:
see
https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3494/artifact/patchprocess/patch-unit-hbase-server.txt

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Found the reason.

In the testcase, we pend the primay call and pass the replica call, but we remove all the callable in SingleServerRequestRunnable.run finally scope, see


          if (callsInProgress != null && callable != null) {

            callsInProgress.remove(callable);

          }

When we cancel the primary request, the response will be null, and if callsInProgress.remove happens before we check the callsInProgress, the testcase will failed.

As the original test case logical, we should not remove the callable in callsInProgress if we cancel the request. I think it is reasonable, because the call is really in progress, we just cancel it at client by ourself.

-1 overall
